publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4894 Nanette Milne: World Ostomy Day—That the Parliament welcomes World Ostomy Day, to be held on 3 October 2009, and the activity of patients’ groups throughout Scotland; notes that every year over 3,000 Scots with serious illnesses such as cancer and inflammatory bowel diseases, such as ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease, undergo stoma surgery to tackle their condition or to ease discomfort and so improve their quality of life, and recognises that events like World Ostomy Day raise awareness of the issues and help promote a public discussion.
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-4894 Nanette Milne: World Ostomy Day—That the Parliament welcomes World Ostomy Day, to be held on 3 October 2009, and the activity of patients’ groups throughout Scotland; notes that every year over 3,000 Scots with serious illnesses such as cancer and inflammatory bowel diseases, including ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease, undergo stoma surgery to tackle their condition or to ease discomfort and so improve their quality of life, and recognises that events like World Ostomy Day raise awareness and help promote public discussion of the issues. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Mary Scanlon*

S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Michael McMahon*, Ian McKee*, Bill Aitken*, John Scott*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Stuart McMillan*, Jackson Carlaw*, John Lamont*, Jamie McGrigor*, Elizabeth Smith*, Sandra White*, Margaret Mitchell*, Bill Butler*, Brian Adam*, Ken Macintosh*, Kenneth Gibson*, Hugh Henry*, Trish Godman*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Aileen Campbell*, Karen Whitefield*, Rob Gibson*, Ross Finnie*, Gil Paterson*, Liam McArthur*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Ted Brocklebank*, Dr Richard Simpson*
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Elaine Murray*
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Rhoda Grant*, Maureen Watt*, Dave Thompson*, Patrick Harvie*
S3M-4894 World Ostomy Day (lodged on 21 September 2009) Andrew Welsh*
